DOCNAME: SELDENRIJK-RAAT AND OTHERS v. THE NETHERLANDS
JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Egbert Myjer;Ineta Ziemele;Josep Casadevall;Kristina Pardalos;Luis López Guerra;Mihai Poalelungi
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants , PERSON - Raat , Mr PERSON and Mr PERSON , are GPE nationals who were born in DATE , DATE and DATE respectively . They live on a farm in Westergeest ( municipality of GPE , province of GPE ) .
CARDINAL

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE CARDINAL animal health inspectors , P. and HCARDINAL , came to inspect a pony kept on the applicants’ farm and thought to be in a state of neglect . The applicants state that on that occasion they gave their full co - operation . The inspectors announced their intention to come back at a future date to take another look at the animal , accompanied by a veterinary surgeon if need be .
CARDINAL . On DATE the inspector PERSON returned , accompanied by CARDINAL uniformed police officers , Officers HCARDINAL and NORP According to the applicants , they had a police dog with them .

CARDINAL . According to official documents , the first applicant refused to admit them onto the LOC . The second applicant then ran towards the inspector and the police officers and tried to push Officer HCARDINAL away . Officer HCARDINAL then grabbed hold of the second applicant and told him that he was under arrest . The second applicant , however , refused to come quietly : he had to be wrestled to the ground by all CARDINAL , PERSON and Officers HCARDINAL and NORP , and brought under control with pepper spray . While this was going on the first applicant tried to pull the officials off the second applicant . The third applicant appeared , waving his arms about and telling the officials to leave . Officer HCARDINAL then sprayed pepper spray into his face . At that , the third applicant left , only to come back with a spade which he brandished in a threatening manner .

CARDINAL . For their part , the applicants deny that the pony was neglected in the first place . They state that the officers failed to identify themselves and that they searched the applicants’ dwelling without a warrant .

CARDINAL . They further allege that the first applicant was struck by Officer HCARDINAL ; that after the second applicant had been subdued and handcuffed , the police officers grabbed him by the neck , closing off his jugular artery and causing him pain and bruising ; that the second applicant was thrown onto the floor of a police van , where he was thrown about on the way to the police station ; that the first and third applicants were driven to the police station without being allowed safety belts ; and that the third applicant ’s mobile telephone was checked for private telephone numbers without the third applicant ’s permission .
CARDINAL . They also allege that following their arrest they asked to see a lawyer but were met with a refusal .
CARDINAL . The applicants were tried before a single - judge chamber ( politierechter ) of ORG ( rechtbank ) of GPE on DATE . Judgment was given DATE .

CARDINAL . The first applicant was found guilty of deliberately obstructing an official charged with investigating criminal acts in the execution of a legal prescript . She was fined CARDINAL ( ORG ) .
CARDINAL . The second applicant was found guilty of resisting an official engaged in his lawful duties ( wederspannigheid ) . He was also fined ORG CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . The third applicant , like the first applicant , was found guilty of deliberately obstructing an official charged with investigating criminal acts in the execution of a legal prescript . He too was fined ORG CARDINAL .
CARDINAL . In each case ORG CARDINAL of the fine was suspended .
CARDINAL . Animal health inspector P. joined the proceedings as a civil party . His claims were declared inadmissible and remitted to the civil courts .
CARDINAL . The applicants appealed .
CARDINAL . The cases were re - heard by a single - judge chamber of ORG ( gerechtshof ) of GPE on DATE . Judgment was given DATE . The applicants were all convicted in the same terms used by ORG .
CARDINAL . The first applicant was fined LAW , ORG CARDINAL of which was suspended . The second and third applicants were each fined ORG CARDINAL , ORG CARDINAL of which was suspended .

CARDINAL . All CARDINAL applicants lodged appeals on points of law with ORG ( PERSON ) . In their statements of points of appeal on points of law ( cassatieschriftuur ) they complained that their conviction did not follow from the evidence . They inspected the case file after it had been transmitted to ORG by ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant wrote to PERSON General to ORG complaining about the disappearance of a number of documents from the file when it was transmitted to ORG by the registry of ORG . Copies of the documents concerned were appended to the letter . It appears that these documents were copies of official police reports with the applicants’ critical remarks added in handwriting and statements by veterinary experts to the effect that the pony was very old but in good health for its age .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Acting Procurator General gave advisory opinions in all CARDINAL cases recommending that the appeals be dismissed as unfounded since the evidence relied on by ORG was quite sufficient and the convictions were sound .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants’ lawyer submitted a letter written by the applicants themselves by way of response to the Acting Procurator General ’s advisory opinion . This letter reiterated the applicants’ complaints about the actions of the various officials and their protestations of innocence . It also mentioned the letter with appended documents which they had written to PERSON ( paragraph CARDINAL above ) and stated that the Procurator General had forwarded it to a member of the registry of ORG for inclusion in the file .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG gave judgment dismissing the appeals on summary reasoning .
